perturbation.original_text: 1.2 It is the goal of the Seller Trusts to have all of the Shares sold, on a pro-rata basis, in three or more tranches (each a "Tranche") commencing not earlier than six (6) months after the Effective Date with the resale of all of the shares of Stock completed as soon as practicable after the Effective Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 It is the goal of the Seller Trusts to have all of the Shares sold, on a pro-rata basis, in three or more tranches (each a "Tranche") commencing not earlier than six (6) months after the Effective Date with the resale of all of the shares of Stock completed no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the deadline for reselling all shares. The original text states that resale should be completed 'as soon as practicable,' which is open to interpretation. The modified text imposes a hard deadline of 'three (3) months after the Effective Date.' This creates uncertainty because 'as soon as practicable' could extend beyond three months, resulting in a breach if the original intent is enforced, or if it is taken literally it would not make sense with commencing 'not earlier than six (6) months after the Effective Date'.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Term; Termination; Withdrawal of Bank. (a) This OMA shall expire upon the earlier of (i) the first anniversary of the Effective Date and (ii) the date that all Shares of Stock of the Seller Trusts as set forth on Schedule A hereto have been sold (the "Term"). Notwithstanding the foregoing, this OMA may be terminated with or without cause at any time after the Effective Date and without liability or continuing obligation by any of the Parties hereto (i) by mutual written agreement of all of the Parties; and (ii) in writing by the Trust Advisors in their sole discretion.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Term; Termination; Withdrawal of Bank. (a) This OMA shall expire upon the earlier of (i) the first anniversary of the Effective Date and (ii) the date that all Shares of Stock of the Seller Trusts as set forth on Schedule A hereto have been sold (the "Term"). Notwithstanding the foregoing, this OMA may only be terminated with cause at any time after the Effective Date and with liability and continuing obligation by any of the Parties hereto (i) by mutual written agreement of all of the Parties; and (ii) in writing by all Parties.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction regarding the termination clause. The original text allows termination 'with or without cause' and 'without liability or continuing obligation.' The modified text stipulates termination 'with cause' only, imposing 'liability and continuing obligation'. This creates uncertainty as the termination terms are now inconsistent. Additionally the original text says the Trust Advisors can terminate in their sole discretion whereas the modification states that all parties must be in agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Assignments and Transfers by Seller Trusts. The provisions of this OMA shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Seller Trusts and their respective successors and assigns. A Seller Trust may transfer or assign, in whole or from time to time in part, to one or more liquidating trusts its rights hereunder in connection with the transfer or resale of Stock held by such Seller Trust, provided that such Seller Trust complies with all laws applicable thereto and provides written notice of assignment to GWG promptly after such assignment is effected, and provided further that such liquidating trust and each beneficiary thereof executes a joinder to this OMA effective as of the date of such assignment or transfer.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4 Assignments and Transfers by Seller Trusts. The provisions of this OMA shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Seller Trusts and their respective successors and assigns. A Seller Trust may transfer or assign, in whole or from time to time in part, to one or more liquidating trusts its rights hereunder in connection with the transfer or resale of Stock held by such Seller Trust. Any assignment to a liquidating trust requires prior written consent from GWG, and GWG is under no obligation to grant consent. Such liquidating trust and each beneficiary thereof must still executes a joinder to this OMA effective as of the date of such assignment or transfer.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows the Seller Trusts to transfer or assign its rights to one or more liquidating trusts, provided that certain conditions are met. The changed text makes the assignment subject to GWG's consent. This creates a contradiction, as it's now unclear if the Seller Trusts can freely assign their rights or if they need GWG's permission, introducing potential disputes over assignment rights.
